numbered_ace_sentences: 1. This is Part 2.
2. I wonder what the term "colored" refers to.
3. I ask whether the term "colored" refers to every non-Caucasian person.
4. I ask whether the term "colored" refers only to African Americans.
5. I am curious about this question.
6. I think that the numbers could change if the meaning of "colored" changes.
7. MLS is more popular in Europe and South America than in the United States.
8. Soccer is not among the three most popular sports in the United States.
9. Many soccer players are not from the United States.
10. I ask whether these facts explain why the numbers are more equal between people of color and non-people-of-color among players and coaches.
11. I wonder why the data for the WNBA is from 2019.
12. I wonder why the data for the WNBA is not from 2020.
13. I ask whether the coronavirus caused the use of 2019 data for the WNBA.
14. I ask whether the WNBA data is less accurate because of the coronavirus.
15. I know that people of color are likely more athletic than white people.
16. I do not think that racism has played a factor in allowing a person of color to play.
17. The charts show that over half of the players are people of color.
18. The charts show an exception for MLB.
19. I believe that racism plays a part in the coaching staff.
20. I believe that racism plays a part in the managing staff.
21. The graphs show a lack of diversity.
22. The impact on my community is to spread awareness of this lack of diversity.
23. In the past decades, there have been major changes in player equality.
24. Many sports organizations have lacked the effort that is needed to add more diversity in leadership roles.
